overview_of_class: The course studies non-competitive markets, both monopolistic behavior as well as strategic firm behavior in markets with few competitors (oligopoly). Examples of topics are: price discrimination, pricing of durable goods, product differentiation, entry, collusion and strategic investment.
name: Industrial Economics
title: WCAS ECON 349-0-20 Industrial Economics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course studies non-competitive markets, both monopolistic behavior as well as strategic firm behavior in markets with few competitors (oligopoly). Examples of topics are: price discrimination, pricing of durable goods, product differentiation, entry, collusion and strategic investment.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minute lectures per week, plus a discussion session for the problem sets (enrollment dependent)

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: A final exam (50%), midterm (35%) and between 5 and 7 problem sets (15%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Industrial Organization: Contemporary Theory and Practice by Pepall, Richards and Norman, 4th Edition (ISBN: 978-1405176323)

subject: ECON
